title: Bring rev-diff into -core
body:
ATM this is a leaf command, but I envision it to become more heavily used with the introduction of `--since` type arguments to commands that can perform incremental processing.

There is a `diff` in -core, but this command is a joke. It doesn't even use properly managed calls to git commands. Key difference between `rev-diff` and `diff` is that the former yields a data structure that is highly similar to that produced by `rev-status` (which should aid adding `--since` to commands that already use `rev-status` internally). Moreover, instead of calling `git diff` it used the same underlying code as `rev-status` and determines differences based on pretty fast `ls-files/ls-tree` calls.

Given the limited use of `diff` in -core, and its sorry state, I think it is worth considering a hard replacement:

- Expose `rev-diff` as `diff` immediately
- RF internal usage by `publish`, `annotate-paths`, `rerun` to either use a then purely internal version of the old `diff`, or the new `diff` right away.

This issue has a relatively low priority. `rev-diff` is likely the least tested of the key -revolution commands, and it is least clear whether its current behavior is optimal wrt all potentially relevant applications.

Check status of https://github.com/datalad/datalad/issues/3192 for placement in -core.
